fields.description:
For our Bamboo installation, the majority of disk space (23GB) is consumed by the files in BAMBOO-HOME/xml-data/builds/*/results and BAMBOO-HOME/xml-data/builds/*/download-data. These files are highly compressible and experiments show gzipping them would reduce the disk space requirements by an order of magnitude.

Bamboo's disk space consumption is a problem for us, and this seems like a trivial solution.
fields.summary: gzip BAMBOO-HOME/xml-data files

fields.description: If the child has no changes but the parents have changes we should trigger the parent builds anyway since the child is a composite of any of its parents.
fields.summary: Dependency blocking when the parent has changes but the child has none

fields.summary: NullPointerException while trying to change SVN URL

fields.description: We would like to see project-level variables that do not require someone to have Bamboo administrator access to set.  We have several different teams using Bamboo and relying on a Bamboo administrator to add/remove/modify the global variables that they use creates a bottleneck.  The alternative is that plans don't use variables at all but that slows projects down in that they have to then go and update each plan manually when there is a global configuration change.  This is similar to to BAM-1237 except it has to do with generic variables, not environment or build-specific variables.
fields.summary: Project Level Global Variables

User should be told that after setting custom capabilities on elastic images, instance has to be restarted

fields.description: I have added 2 capabilities: visualstudio and NAnt. Even though Bamboo seems to like the agent (there is a green tick in agent matrix), job configuration shows that 0 agents have the capability - see screenshot
fields.summary: Elastic agent capabilities not shown properly

fields.description: Bamboo can't do a partial checkout or update, it just updates everything. Bamboo does have an include/exclude feature for monitoring changes but it would be nice to ignore directories during checkout.
fields.summary: Partial update with subversion
Elastic instance on Windows cannot be shut down when agent crashed

fields.description:
3 weeks ago I created this plan:
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC5-FEDEX15FAVPAR/
by cloning this one
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CONFFUNC-PARA
And editing the PLAN's repository.
The original plan currently says that the job inherits the repo details from the plan.
But the copied plan did not do that apparently.  (I have updated it today)

This is an extremely critical bug since:
* the reporting on the plan shows that each commit on the branch results in a new build
* the actual job runs against the wrong repository
fields.summary: Repository inheritance problem with cloned converted plans

fields.description: When I'm looking at a build the majority of them have only one job. So to look at a running job I need to, click on the spinner AND then on Default Job. It'd be nice if I was directed straight to Default Job.
fields.summary: Remove the intermediary view for build chains with only one job

fields.description: It seems to me that to configure a job you have to go to the summary tab of the plan.  When I go looking to configure a job detail I naturally click on the configuration tab first.  Then when the thing I want to configure turns out to be part of the job, not part of the plan, I need to configure the job.  But there is no link to the job's configuration from here.  For a user adjusting to the new changes, this makes it seem like the configuration options I want have just totally disappeared.
fields.summary: Add Job configuration link to Plan configuration page

fields.description:
as in [BAM-7027|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-7027]

We actually don't support windows network shares as repository URL.
And we should as hg supports too.
fields.summary: Mercurial plugin should be able to work on windows shares (\\servername\resource\repo) (a.k.a "Path issue")

fields.description:
In the Apache Ant build.xml for a PHP-based project I use PHP_Depend to generate software visualizations in SVG format. These SVG files are stored as an artifact by Bamboo. Unfortunately, Bamboo's built-in webserver does not send the correct headers and / or MIME type so that a web browser wants to download (and save) the files instead of showing them. PNG files, however, are served correctly.

It would be nice if Bamboo would serve SVG files correctly. Thanks!
fields.summary: Bamboo's built-in webserver does not serve SVG files properly

fields.summary: Protect the Home-Directory files from being deleted when the server hard drive is full

fields.description:
At the moment, to build a build screen using the REST API, you need to retrieve the plan information (to get the plan name) and the build information (to get the state of the build).

It would be much better if the plan resource also included the current state of the plan: successful or failed.

In addition, I think an expandable sub-resource of the plan for the last build and any currently-running build would be really useful for clients too.
fields.summary: Include plan state (e.g. successful/failed) in REST plan response

fields.description: e.g. in the jobs list, instead of showing just the regular "13 Minutes slower than usual" next to a hung job, show the text in red and put (Build Hung) next to it.

fields.description:
It would be cool if we could manually order the builds on the telemetry view.

For example, I care more about the Crowd Trunk Main Build than I do about a TPM build, etc.

It would be even more awesome if I could define the amount of real estate a build could take on screen - eg. mark a build as taking the full length of the screen, or half the length of the screen. If the main build is red, then I want it screaming at my face ;)
fields.summary: Ordering builds on telemetry screen

fields.description:
Essentially I have a chain waiting to build (not agents to pick it up).  I have gone into one of the jobs and clicked stop.  The job then goes into a not-built state (cause it was still in the queue)

And now the logs are being filled up with:
{code}
5:02,207 INFO [603288932@qtp-110977125-7] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://localhost:8085/bamboo/rest/api/latest/build/CHAINPROJ-CHAIN-224?_=1287375902205&expand=stages.stage.results.result 219973kb
2010-10-18 15:25:02,352 WARN [603288932@qtp-110977125-7] [BuildResultsSummaryImpl] This should not happen: getTimeDelta with b == null && !isActive()
{code}

The code seems to be asking for the queued time even when the build has been cancelled.  There are no bad effects in the UI, just lots and lots of logs saying that something "should not happen"
fields.summary: Stage results list does not like it when you stop a build in the queue / Rest asking for queue duration on non-active job.
For Jobs, can't navigate to last result with Build results navigator

fields.description:
The new {{telemetry.action}} broke the Confluence wallboard which was using Greasemonkey to filter the build results.

It would be nice if there was a way to choose the layout/design and to make the new wallboard "opt-in".
fields.summary: New telemetry.action broke our wallboard

fields.description:
I am using https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/telemetry.action?filter=favourites to monitor our builds. 
With the new wallboard this has become rather difficult as the build does not link back to the build result anymore.

Clicking on the build result box now opens an overlay with further information.
fields.summary: New wallboard doesn't work for local monitoring of builds anymore

fields.description:
Upgrade task 1831 will fail for every instance using a Case-Sensitive.

{code}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,052 INFO [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [UpgradeManagerImpl] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,052 INFO [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [UpgradeManagerImpl] Running upgrade task 1831 : Setting null build_completed_date fields to build_date.
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,052 INFO [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [UpgradeManagerImpl] -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,068 INFO [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [UpgradeTask1831FixNullBuildCompleted] Unable to determine whether to run: Setting null build_completed_date fields to build_date.
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,068 INFO [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [AbstractStatementUpgradeTask] Executing SQL: update BUILDRESULTSUMMARY set build_completed_date = build_date where build_completed_date is null
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 2010-10-13 02:40:08,068 ERROR [WrapperSimpleAppMain] [AbstractStatementUpgradeTask] Unable to run update BUILDRESULTSUMMARY set build_completed_date = build_date where build_completed_date is null : Invalid column name 'build_completed_date'.
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | java.sql.SQLException: Invalid column name 'build_completed_date'.
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:368)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2816)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2254)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:631)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.processResults(JtdsStatement.java:584)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/10/13 02:40:08 | 	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQL(JtdsStatement.java:546)
{code}

*Immediate Workaround*
1. Run the [upgrade steps|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+Generic+Upgrade+Guide] and allow Bamboo to execute until the problem with Task 1831 happen.
2. Shutdown Bamboo.
3. Open file <Bamboo-Home>/bamboo.cfg.xml and change the *buildNumber* to 1831. Then, restart the new Bamboo instance.
fields.summary: Upgrade task 1831 will fail for every instance using a Case-Sensitive DB

fields.description:
Our current set up consists in several maven projects having the same parent pom project.
Note that this parent project is NOT an aggregate project meaning it does not any of all the other projects as modules - which is totally allowed in the maven world.

All our builds (except the one for the parent common pom project) seem to fail with the message:
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48  	[INFO] BUILD SUCCESSFUL
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	[INFO] Total time: 44 seconds
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	[INFO] Finished at: Fri Sep 17 13:58:48 CST 2010
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	[INFO] Final Memory: 51M/63M
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	Build process for 'Libraries - projectX' returned with return code = 0
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	Running post build plugin 'Artifact Copier'
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	Running post build plugin 'Clover Results Collector'
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48 	Running post build plugin 'NCover Results Collector'
17-Sep-2010 13:58:48  	Running post build plugin 'Maven2 Build Processor'
17-Sep-2010 13:58:49 	Failed to execute plugin 'Maven2 Build Processor' with error: Cannot find parent: our.organisation:master-pom for project: our.organisation:projectX:pom:1.1-SNAPSHOT for project our.organisation:projectX:pom:1.1-SNAPSHOT
17-Sep-2010 13:58:49 	Finalising the build...

Although the build is marked as successful, the whole bamboo maven 2 dependency system which should set up the dependencies correctly is not triggered and none of the dependencies are set up.
I am not sure if the message relates anyhow to our problem though.

Thanks
fields.summary: Maven 2 build processor fails to find parent projects

anything where we use toggle=true seems to be broken now in IE7.
fields.summary: No field toggles are working in ie7

fields.description:
I have several projects that have 15-40 plans in them.  They live for varying lengths of time, corresponding to the life of the branch they are building.  I want the ability to disable the whole lot of them once the branch terminates.

Ideally, I'd also like a better method to clone an entire project as well, rather than 1 plan at a time.
fields.summary: I want to be able to disable an entire project at once

fields.description: We currently have 52 agents and over 300 build plans.  Using the agent matrix is almost impossible.  There needs to be a way to filter the matrix, to only look at a subset of plans, or a subset of agents.  Or, alternatively, use frames, so the headers are not lost.  Otherwise, you are just swimming in a sea of red Xs and green check marks with absolutely no context.
fields.summary: The Agent and Plans Matrix is almost unusable

fields.description: Quite often we clone our build VMs, however, we cannot clone the capabilities for the agents, and have to manually copy all the capabilities to the new agent.  It seems that it would be trivial to add this as a feature, and it would save us a lot of time.
fields.summary: It should be possible to clone agents

fields.description:
Currently plugins have no easy way to add environment variables to a build at build time.
The only way to do it is by saving the environment variables in the plan via the AbstractBuilder and this only works in a PreBuildQueuedAction (server side)

It would be better if plugins could add values to a map at build time that also got included in the list of env vars.
fields.summary: Ability to add ENV Vars via plugins

- make jsvn and jsvn.bat use the same configuration file for logs

fields.description:
Currently, we already have a 64bit version of wrapper working for Bamboo Agents. Bamboo Server, however, is distributed only with a 32bit version of wrapper. This means that when Bamboo Server is run in 64bit JVM, it will display a warning saying that signals will not be handled. The server itself will start and will use the wrapper.

We should distribute both versions of wrapper (maybe it will be enough to distribute just the libraries, not the executables) and run the correct one depending on the JVM used (or at least make it possible for the user to choose the correct wrapper library version).
fields.summary: Support for 64bit wrapper for Bamboo Server

fields.description:
The dataprovider feature in testng can run the same test against multiple datasets. We use this feature in the HG functional tests, UrlRewriteFilter tests, etc. We should at least try to handle this issue gracefully.

The following result has one failing test and one successful test of the same name
http://tardigrade.sydney.atlassian.com:8085/bamboo/browse/BAM-FC-HG-1155

fields.description: Updating build strategy eg from repository polling to triggering or vice versa, changing polling interval or authorized trigger origin IP are actions usually done on project or whole installation level. A bulk action would eliminate much repetitive clicking.
fields.summary: Add bulk action for updating build strategy

fields.description:
Due to an undocumented behaviour of PathFindOnPath Win32 API function, directory list scanning is terminated once an empty directory name is found on the list.
For Java Service Wrapper, this condition is met when the PATH variable contains at least two consecutive semicolons.

This can have on of the following side effects:
1. Java is not found at all.
2. Java from Windows System directory is used instead of the one specified in path.
fields.summary: Wrapper fails to find (expected) Java if path contains consecutive semicolons

fields.description:
Any plugin that requires variable substitution via the VariableSubstitutionBean has to be a V1 plugin because the VSB is not exposed to V2 plugins.

This was discovered during: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/BPBC-41

Emails were exchanged regarding this as well:

Mark Chai:
-------------
The VSB is a prototype scoped bean so it can't be made available in OSGI.

I'm not 100% sure if it _has_ to be a prototype (it does access the AdminConfigManager but doesn't seem to cache anything). 

If you have Bamboo building from source, you could try to switch the prototype flag off on the application context definition and plugin:available="true" and see if that works.

Jonathan Doklovic (response):
-----------------------------
I just updated the applicationContextCommon.xml inside of bamboo-agent-core within the container that amps uses.
Removed the prototype scope and added plugins:available="true".  

This has no effect. When I run my plugin, the VSB still does not get injected into my action.  :(  http://www.sadtrombone.com/
fields.summary: VariableSubstitutionBean cannot be used in V2 plugins

My Project Name: AAAA
My Chain Name: AAAA

In one instance I tried to update an existing job to have the name AAAA.  I got a validation error. I should theoretically be able to name my plan like this shouldn't I?

During an attempt to reproduce the above behaviour, I tried to create a _new_ Job with the name AAAA.  This submitted successfully.  However now I get a whole bunch of other exceptions:

{code}
2010-09-30 10:17:41,755 ERROR [1638360365@qtp-1196121930-6] [FiveOhOh] 500 Exception was thrown.
org.springframework.dao.IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException: query did not return a unique result: 2
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:590)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateAccessor.convertHibernateAccessException(HibernateAccessor.java:353)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:375)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:337)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanHibernateDao.getPlanByName(PlanHibernateDao.java:83)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
{code}

The getPlanByName method only looks at the project name and plan name in the build table.  And hence will return both the chain and the job. 

So we need to either
a) prevent people from creating jobs with the same name as a plan (though this behaves the opposite to how we handle the keys)
b) fix the getPlanByName method, and any other use cases which die because of the duplication.
fields.summary: Job/Chain Name duplication throws exception

fields.description:
I came across with the problem that every time I change the repository URL of any plans, bamboo removed all the files in the working directory, including the artifacts and the build.xml.
For my experience using other ci's I would suggest to put the repository files in a subfolder, called source, or something similar so, the directory structure will be

/home/bambo/xml-data/build-dir/PRJ-PROJECT/build.xml
                                         -build/ (artifacts)
                                        -source/ (svn files)

So if you have to put anything else like a post-action script or something that can run in the working directory you should rest assure that they are not gonna be deleted.

That's my suggestion maybe you guys have something in mind.

Thanks in advance

Marcelo
fields.summary: Repository Folder in sub folder under working directory

fields.description:
This plan: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/CRUCHG-CHAIN-FUNC-23
failed due to:
{code}
The build has failed to check out the source code: command [/usr/bin/hg, update, --clean, --rev, 8658647caaeafcada4c4486ed7b75a5b28dae95e, --config, ui.ssh=ssh -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -i /tmp/bambooHg5093194156945601042.tmp] failed. stderr: abort: There is no Mercurial repository here (.hg not found)!
stdout: 
Error occurred while executing the build for CRUCHG-CHAIN-FUNC-23 : command [/usr/bin/hg, update, --clean, --rev, 8658647caaeafcada4c4486ed7b75a5b28dae95e, --config, ui.ssh=ssh -o "StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -i /tmp/bambooHg5093194156945601042.tmp] failed. stderr: abort: There is no Mercurial repository here (.hg not found)!
stdout: 
{code}

This was possibly caused by build CRUCHG-CHAIN-FUNC-22, that was manually stopped, and due to a forked running server, failed to delete the entire build directory.

When the HG-Bamboo plugin runs, it should check the 'force clean build' flag, and delete the entire working directory if it exists. 

Also - the logging:
{code}
Pulling from local cache repository to source directory
{code}

should accurately reflect the exact HG command being executed. ie. either a pull or a clone ?
fields.summary: HG plugin should handle .hg dir not existsing in current directory
Discrepancy in time estimations in a single-job chain between job and chain

fields.description:
Bamboo currently uses the spring HibernateInterceptor around things like SaveBuildTask.call().  This creates a session, but doesn't create a transaction.  If something else further down the track creates a transaction, for example, if a plugin makes a call to bandana to read some configuration, then that transaction will be linked to the session created.  If it's a read only transaction, and before it was started, there were some unflushed changes to the session, this will fail when the session is flushed when that transaction completes.

Bamboo should not be using the HibernateInterceptor in this instance, it should rather be using the org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor, which will ensure that things down the track use the same transaction.
fields.summary: Use of HibernateInterceptor results in unpredictable behaviour

fields.description:
I write quite a lot of DataProvider tests.
In essence, this means the same test method is executed multiple times, with different parameters.
TestNG reports them as:
myTestMethod("First param")
myTestMethod("Second param")
myTestMethod("Third param")

However, Bamboo seems to only take the test method name into account, not the params.
As the result, if the test fails for the "Second param", I get the report only for the first ("First param") execution
fields.summary: DataProvider based TestNG tests are improperly reported

fields.description:
When cloning a plan: if you change the builder type from Ant to Maven then Bamboo adds Ant and Maven as a requirement to the plan.

Ideally, Bamboo should detect that the builder has changed and set the requirement to Maven from ant in the next screen.
fields.summary: Changing the builder type during cloning adds multiple builder requirements

fields.description:
Right now only explicit project dependencies are picked up by Maven2 dependency analyzer.

In fact, a project is also implicitly dependent on it's immediate parent projects and all maven plugins that are required to build it. If any of those artifacts is provided by build plans deployed to the same Bamboo instance (which is almost always the case with parent project) a dependency relationship between the plans should be established.

The list of plugin artifacts needed for the build is readily available in Maven2 model classes. Please refer to maven-dependency-plugin dependency:resolve-plugins for an example.

As a workaround, one can add both parent project (using dependency type pom) and required plugins (using depdendency type maven-plugin) as explicit dependencies of the project. Then, Bamboo's dependency analyzer picks them up correctly. However it adds a bit of maintenance burden that could be easily eliminated.
fields.summary: Maven2 depdency analyzer should Include parent project and required plugins into project's dependencies
Delayed deletion does not delete directories when concurrent builds are enabled

fields.description:
In https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-10404 customer's EBS snapshot went missing, and Bamboo would start the EC2 image and the image would shutdown because the EBS snapshot no longer exists.

We should make sure the EBS snapshot exists before attempting to attach it.
fields.summary: Check if the EBS snapshot exists when the EC2 instance starts

fields.description: I had Bamboo 2.6.1 installed on my Windows 7 machine. I tried to install 2.6.2 without manually uninstalling the previous version. The installer found previous version, uninstalled it and installed new one. When I tried to run the Bamboo it failed saying that duplicated plugins were found. Indeed in the WEB-INF/lib directory there were plenty of duplicated jars but in different versions.
fields.summary: Bamboo upgrade process fails on Windows

fields.description:
I have installed bamboo 2.6.1 around 2 months ago. 
Everything is ok, but yesterday I tried to install the atlassian wallboard plugin in jira, and a faced the problem that:
1 - All the gadgets in bamboo goes to a 404 Page not found error.
http://bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/status/planStatus.xml
http://bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/charts/bambooCharts.xml
http://bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/charts/planSummaryChart.xml
etc...
2 - I also have tried just to access to the rest page by http://localhost:8085/rest or by apache proxy http://bamboo/rest and I have a 404 error
3 - I tried to add OAuth Consumers into bamboo but there's not such a link under Gadgets or any other part in administration area.

Logs doesn't show anything valuable:
(bamboo.log under /etc/bamboo/logs/

DEBUG  | wrapper  | 2010/09/22 11:02:42 | Got ping response from JVM
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2010/09/22 11:02:43 | 2010-09-22 11:02:43,502 INFO [12977048@qtp-32477527-27] [AccessLogFilter] admin http://bamboo/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/status/planStatus.xml 176686kb

Please let me know what I did wrong and how to fix it.. 

Thanks in advance

Marcelo

fields.description: Seen on EC2 on Bamboo Server for functional tests. The server seems to be working well in general, but you cannot enter http://localhost:9087/bamboo/admin/user/viewUsers.action - if you do, this session hangs (but Bamboo continues to operate).
fields.summary: Bamboo hangs on "View Users"

fields.description:
As an Administrator edits the plans, the *AJS.conglomerate.cookie* stores the UI history. However, Bamboo is not resetting the cookie value often enough to avoid it getting too big.

This causes the web/app server to report HTTP error 413.
fields.summary: If AJS.conglomerate.cookie gets too big, web servers will report HTTP error 413
Post Build Actions not being run for jobs.
We suck at float when we have plan description when creating a Job

fields.description:
Currently we just throw RepositoryExceptions.
Some errors - esp 'authentication failure' - should be explicitly added to the log so the user sees it.

Blocker - if it happens in change detection phase, the log is not visible at the moment - difficult to test.
